title: Abarema glauca
text:
Abarema glauca, the glaucous abarema, is a <a href="tree">tree</a> <a href="species">species</a> in the legume <a href="family%20%28biology%29">family</a> (<a href="Fabaceae">Fabaceae</a>). It is found in <a href="Cuba">Cuba</a>, <a href="Dominican%20Republic">Dominican Republic</a>, and <a href="Venezuela">Venezuela</a>. Common rural names are: <a href="caracol%C3%AD">caracolí</a>, nijaguao, paují (Pittier), jijaguao, and merey montañero (Hoyos).
Abarema glauca is found most easily on the east coast of <a href="Dominican%20Republic">Dominican Republic</a>, in <a href="Uvero%20Alto">Uvero Alto</a>, <a href="north">north</a> of <a href="Punta%20Cana">Punta Cana</a>..
<a href="Junior%20synonym">Junior synonym</a>s are:
